titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn and Jamaica Plank Road Company records 1978.037
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-12-27 21:42:49 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Brooklyn and Jamaica Plank Road Company records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Brooklyn and Jamaica Plank Road Company

did.abstract: The Brooklyn and Jamaica Plank Road Company records contain abstracts of laws authorizing the organization of the Brooklyn Jamaica and Flatbush Turnpike Company, the building of the road, and laws closing portions of the road lying within the city in Brooklyn.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The records were formally accessioned in 1978.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn and Jamaica Plank Road Company records, 1978.037, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Brooklyn and Jamaica Plank Road Company records span the period 1807 to 1875 and contain abstracts of laws authorizing the organization of the Brooklyn Jamaica and Flatbush Turnpike Company, the building of the road, and laws closing portions of the road lying within the city in Brooklyn.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection are in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
